abstract: HSBC has signed a deal to buy 10 percent of Vietnam Insurance, a move that seems to hav only increased the ire of an activist shareholder who is calling for a review of the bank’s operations. HSBC Insurance said that it had purchased the stake from Vietnamese firm, known as BaoViet, for 4,121 billion Vietnamese dollars ($254 million).
lead_paragraph: HSBC has signed a deal to buy 10 percent of Vietnam Insurance, a move that seems to hav only increased the ire of an activist shareholder who is calling for a review of the bank’s operations. HSBC Insurance said that it had purchased the stake from Vietnamese firm, known as BaoViet, for 4,121 billion Vietnamese dollars ($254 million).

headline.main: HSBC’s Asian Deal Irks Activist Investor
